description: A list of map operations to be applied to a map for cleaning purposes in order
name: Cleaning Options

members.description: Enable cleaning options
members.name: Enabled

members.description: Select or deselect all cleaning options
members.name: Select All

members.description: Before any cleaning, reproject to a planar projection (e.g. UTM).
members.name: Reproject To Planar Option

members.description: Remove duplicate ways (lines) that are exact duplicates. If the lines partially overlap with exactly the same geometry then only the partial overlap is removed from the more complex geometry.
members.name: Remove Duplicate Way

members.description: Remove all ways that contain no nodes or all the nodes are exactly the same.
members.name: Remove Superfluous Way

members.description: Split all highway type ways that intersect.
members.name: Intersection Splitter

members.description: Remove implied intersections that are likely incorrect. For example, a motorway overpass intersecting a residential street at a 90Â° is considered unlikely and "unsnapped". The geometry location is not modified.
members.name: Remove Unlikely Intersection

members.description: Split highway types that are marked as divided into two separate geometries marked as oneway roads. A number of assumptions must be made to do this including assumptions about the direction of travel on roads (right or left hand drivers).
members.name: DualWay Splitter

members.description: If two roads implicitly should be marked as divided based on the surrounding roads, mark it as such. This is primarily caused by the FACC+ spec which does not allow bridges to be marked as divided.
members.name: Implied Divided Marker

members.description: Remove any duplicate names. See `duplicate.name.case.sensitive` for modifying the case sensitivity.
members.name: Remove Duplicate Name

members.description: Merge any ludicrously small ways that have essentially the same attributes. Things like `UUID` are ignored. See `small.way.merger.threshold` for setting the threshold value.
members.name: Small Way Merger

members.description: If highways are smaller than threshold and the tags matched then they will be merged together into a single way.
members.name: Small Way Merger Threshold

members.description: Remove all area elements that have a area of zero.
members.name: Remove Empty Areas

members.description: Remove any area elements that are essentially the same.
members.name: Remove Duplicate Area

members.description: Remove any elements that don't have any tags with information. (E.g. only contains UUID and source, but not FCODE equivalent or other informative tags).
members.name: Remove No Information Element

members.description: Frechet Distance
members.name: Frechet Distance

members.description: The way subline matcher to use when determining matching sublines.
members.name: Way Subline Matcher (Frechet)

members.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait for the optimizer to complete. A value of -1 makes the time limit unlimited. If this value is set to something other than -1 your conflation results may change between multiple runs. Especially if the machine Hoot is running on is under heavy load. If the "CM Score:" value is changing between runs and GLPK isn't finding an optimal solution then this is likely causing different output. Just because the output is changing doesn't mean it is wrong, but this can be problematic if you're doing testing or expecting repeatable output for other
members.name: Unify Optimizer Time Limit

members.description: If the list of o2s tags is > 255 char, split it into into 254 char long pieces. If this is false, it will be exported as one big string.
members.name: OGR Split O2S

members.description: Add the ESRI specific FCSUBTYPE field to the output
members.name: OGR Esri FCSubtype

members.description: Export data in Thematic Groups (TransportationGroundCrv, StructurePnt etc) instead of one FCODE per file/layer (ROAD_L, BUILDING_P etc).
members.name: OGR Thematic Structure

members.description: If checked, the duplicate name remover will only remove duplicate names when their case also matches; Will ignore case when removing otherwise
members.name: Duplicate Name Case Sensitive

members.description: Size of the cache used when streaming I/O is used with nodes.
members.name: Element Cache Size Node

members.description: Size of the cache used when streaming I/O is used with relations.
members.name: Element Cache Size Relation

members.description: Size of the cache used when streaming I/O is used with ways.
members.name: Element Cache Size Way

members.description: Enable road options
members.name: Enabled

members.description: A list of road engines
members.name: Engines

members.description: Unify options
members.name: Unify

members.description: The highway match classifier to use. This should only be used for testing and debugging.
members.name: Conflate Match Highway Classifier

members.description: List of MatchCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Match Creator

members.description: List of MergerCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Merger Creator

members.description: The search radius to use when conflating highways. If two features are within the search radius then they will be considered for conflation. If the value is -1 then the circular error will be used to calculate an appropriate search radius.
members.name: Search Radius Highway

members.description: The distance around a point on a way to look when calculating the heading. A larger value will smooth out the heading values on a line. A smaller value will make the heading values correspond directly to the heading on the way at that point. This is primarily used in subline matching. Values are in meters.
members.name: Highway Matcher Heading Delta

members.description: Sets that maximum angle that is still considered a highway match. Units in degrees.
members.name: Highway Matcher Max Angle

members.description: The minimum size that a way should be split into for merging. Units in meters.
members.name: Way Merger Min Split Size

members.description: Network Conflation Options
members.name: Network

members.description: List of MatchCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Match Creator

members.description: List of MergerCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Merger Creator

members.description: The network matcher to use during conflation. This option represents different algorithms used for scoring matches.
members.name: Network Matcher

members.description: Differential Conflation
members.name: Differential

members.description: List of MatchCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Match Creator

members.description: List of MergerCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Merger Creator

members.description: The network matcher to use during conflation. This option represents different algorithms used for scoring matches.
members.name: Network Matcher

members.description: The subline matcher to use
members.name: Way Subline Matcher

members.description: Enable area options
members.name: Enabled

members.description: Enable building options
members.name: Enabled

members.description: List of MatchCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Match Creator

members.description: List of MergerCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Merger Creator

members.description: Enable POI options
members.name: Enabled

members.description: If true, POI to POI conflation will ignore the types of the features being compared completely as long as those being compared have a populated name field.
members.name: Ignore Type If Name Present

description: Hootenanny POI to Polygon conflation options
name: POI to Polygon Options

members.description: Enable POI to Polygon options
members.name: Enabled

members.description: List of MatchCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Match Creator

members.description: List of MergerCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Merger Creator

members.description: POI to Polygon Name Score Threshold
members.name: Name Score Threshold

members.description: The minimum similarity the type scores a POI and polygon can have and be considered a type match, with 0.0 being the least similar and 1.0 being the most similar.
members.name: Type Score Threshold

members.description: The maximum distance, in meters, between a POI and a polygon where they can still be considered a match based on distance criteria only.
members.name: Match Distance Threshold

members.description: The maximum distance, in meters, between a POI and a polygon where they can still be considered for review based on distance criteria only (value is added to the circular error of the compared features).
members.name: Review Distance Threshold

members.description: List of key value pairs (key=value) for features to always review if marked as matches with POI to polygon conflation. When specifying the list from the command line, delimit the types with ';' and surround the entire value string in double quotes.
members.name: Review If Matched Types

members.description: If true, POI to polygon conflation will not attempt to conflate two features with the same source tag value. e.g. both have 'source=osm' tag The source tag key is specified by poi.polygon.source.tag.key. This setting is useful when you have a data layer where data has been collected as both POIs and polygons for the same source and you never want the two source to be conflated together.
members.name: Disable Same Source Conflation

members.description: If false and poi.polygon.disable.same.source.conflation is set to true, POI to polygon conflation will disable conflation only between features who have the exact same source tag value. e.g. both have 'source=osm' tag If set to false, then the tag matcher is less strict and will attempt to match the prefix of the source tag value when delimited by a colon. e.g. 'source=mgcp:buildp_clip;osm' will match 'source=mgcp:builda_clip;osm' since both tag values begin with 'mgcp:'.
members.name: Disable Same Source Conflation Match Tag Key Prefix Only

members.description: The source tag key to be used with poi.polygon.disable.same.source.conflation.
members.name: Source Tag Key

members.description: If true, POI to polygon conflation will classify all points with OSM address tags as POIs even if they do not have specific type tags.
members.name: Promote Points With Addresses to POIs

members.description: The minimum evidence score at which a POI will be reviewed against a polygon, if the evidence score does not meet the threshold defined by 'poi.polygon.match.evidence.threshold'. Valid values are 0 to 3. If an evidence score for a feature pair falls below this value, the relationship between the features will be classified as a miss. If the value is set to 0, all feature pairs which did not match will be reviewed. If the value is set greater than or equal to 'poi.polygon.match.evidence.threshold', an error will occur. Generally, this setting should not be changed except when working with specific POI/Polygon conflation use cases that require it.
members.name: Review Evidence Threshold

members.description: Enable waterway options
members.name: Enabled

members.description: List of MatchCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Match Creator

members.description: List of MergerCreators to use during conflation. This can modify what features will be conflated (e.g. buildings, roads, etc.).
members.name: Merger Creator

members.description: The way subline matcher to use when determining matching sublines.
members.name: Waterway Subline Matcher

members.description: Distance, in meters, used for sampling during angle histogram extraction with the SampledAngleHistogramExtractor
members.name: Waterway Angle Sample Distance

members.description: The distance around a point on a way to look when calculating the heading. A larger value will smooth out the heading values on a line. A smaller value will make the heading values correspond directly to the heading on the way at that point. This is primarily used in subline matching. Values are in meters.
members.name: Waterway Matcher Heading Delta

members.description: Automatically calculates the search radius to be used during conflation of waterways using rubber sheet tie point distances.  When this setting is enabled, rubbersheeting is not allowed as a pre-conflation operation on the input data to be conflated.
members.name: Waterway Auto Calc Search Radius

members.description: The search radius to use when conflating highways. If two features are within the search radius then they will be considered for conflation. If the value is -1 then the circular error will be used to calculate an appropriate search radius.
members.name: Search Radius Waterway

members.description: Sets the minimum number of tie points that will be used when calculating a rubber sheeting solution.
members.name: Waterway Rubber Sheet Minimum Ties

members.description: If this configuration setting is set to true then the first layer is treated as the reference layer and will not be moved. If set to false the two layers will be moved towards each other. The weighting is determined based on the circular error.
members.name: Waterway Rubber Sheet Ref
